description.narrative: This project aims at strengthening coastal communities to manage climate risks and impacts for their livelihood and safe living.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: The percentage change in vulnerability of youth and women living in the pilot sites to climate change induced risks threatening the coastal zone.

comment.narrative: The baseline will be determined in the pilot sites through a VRA

1. 6 Automated Oceanographic Monitoring system installed 2. At least 12 Technical staff trained in coastal hazard risks & vulnerability assessment. 3. At least 1 Sea Level Rise (SLR) and Coastal Erosion profile developed 4. At least 1 adaptation plan developed & shared with relevant stakeholders 5. Four (4) Working Groups on ICZM established 6. At least 2 additional outreach communication strategies for ICZM is designed, one each by MFMR & NTB 7. By end of the year 2019, at least 3 strategies for alternative livelihoods developed to strengthen women and sand miner youth association’s resilience to CC impact. 8. At least 8 Protection measures are in place in coastal communities

1.1: 4 Automated Oceanographic Monitoring system installed by Dec. 2020; 1.2: at least 12 Technical staff trained to assess Coastal Hazard risk through probabilistic modelling; 1.3: At least 50% of data collected has a link with existing CIDMEWS by Dec. 2020; 1.4: At least 4 key staff (2 each from EPA & IMBO) capacitated in GIS & Risk/vulnerability mapping by Dec. 2020; 1.4a: 2 (1 each from MFMR & IMBO) trained in electronic & data transmission & exchange skills to effectively carry out coastal vulnerability assessment ; 1.4b: At least 10 staff (disaggregated by sex) in target Government institutions capacitated in participatory & GIS mapping, risk assessment, climate model & CVA interpretation 2.1: By Dec. 2020, at least 1 Sea Level Rise and coastal erosion profiles with required parameters developed 2.2: At least 2 adaptation guidance developed & shared with stakeholders by Dec. 2020 2.3: By Dec. 2020, at least 1 Marine spatial plan framework is in place. 2.4: At least 6 (1 each per project site) Working Groups to support ICZM is established by Dec. 2020 3.1: By Dec. 2020, at least 2 additional outreach communication strategy for ICZM is designed & implemented. 3.2: At least 3 strategies for alternative livelihoods developed and implemented by end of Dec 2020 3.3: At least 1 pilot site where CSEB practices are introduced is in place by Dec. 2020 3.3a: At least 200 youth are involved in CSEB practices, 3.4: At least 100 Ha of degraded mangrove areas rehabilitated and restored in Coastal communities 3.4a: At least 8 protection measures (disaggregated by type) are in place in target coastal communities 3.5: At least 6 project sites have early warning mechanism in place by Dec. 2020
